channel.title: Comments on: Merry Christmas, 11 by ~@Himmapaan on deviantART

item.title: By: mattvr
item.dc:creator: mattvr
item.description:
It's easy to draw comparisons, but can be frustrating for the artist.
The theme park wopuld keep you in work for a little while! Though James Gurney has done the smart thing and managed to produce the mythos to go with his art and made the merch to go with it!
item.content:encoded:
It’s easy to draw comparisons, but can be frustrating for the artist.

The theme park wopuld keep you in work for a little while! Though James Gurney has done the smart thing and managed to produce the mythos to go with his art and made the merch to go with it!

item.title: By: himmapaan
item.dc:creator: himmapaan
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/merry-christmas-11-by-himmapaan-on-deviantart/#comment-51">mattvr</a>.
Thank you so much, Matt! How interesting, someone else also recently mentioned the Pieck echoes! I must admit that that was also my first acquaintance with the artist. I can see what you mean, as Pieck was of course working very closely within the traditions of the 'Golden Age' illustrators, who are among <i>my</i> own influences.
Now if someone would just have the idea of building a theme park based on my work, huh? ;)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to mattvr.

Thank you so much, Matt! How interesting, someone else also recently mentioned the Pieck echoes! I must admit that that was also my first acquaintance with the artist. I can see what you mean, as Pieck was of course working very closely within the traditions of the ‘Golden Age’ illustrators, who are among my own influences.

Now if someone would just have the idea of building a theme park based on my work, huh? ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: mattvr
item.dc:creator: mattvr
item.description:
Beautiful stuff as usual Himma!
Reminds me a little of the work of Anton Pieck. There's a real ornamental feel to much of your stuff, as if you're portraying images from an old mythical tradition.
item.content:encoded:
Beautiful stuff as usual Himma!

Reminds me a little of the work of Anton Pieck.
There’s a real ornamental feel to much of your stuff, as if you’re portraying images from an old mythical tradition.

item.title: By: himmapaan
item.dc:creator: himmapaan
item.description:
Thank you so much, Jon! The baskets contain <i>some</i> fruit, but they are mostly filled with parcels: gifts of various kinds! You'll also notice a few bottles which may contain something to your liking. ;)
Small people of no specific description <a href="http://fav.me/d31p9r7" rel="nofollow">seem</a> to <a href="http://fav.me/d3fsi96" rel="nofollow">frequently</a> occur in <a href="http://fav.me/d365247" rel="nofollow">my universe</a>, as it were. I suppose they may have something elvish about them, but they are also influenced by artists like William Heath Robinson and Andrej and Olga Dugina.
item.content:encoded:
Thank you so much, Jon! The baskets contain some fruit, but they are mostly filled with parcels: gifts of various kinds! You’ll also notice a few bottles which may contain something to your liking. ðŸ˜‰

Small people of no specific description seem to frequently occur in my universe, as it were. I suppose they may have something elvish about them, but they are also influenced by artists like William Heath Robinson and Andrej and Olga Dugina.
